      • getUserDevice

        public com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device getUserDevice(String userId,
                                               String devId)
                                                 throws InvalidDeviceId,
                                                        InvalidUserId,
                                                        DeviceNotOwnedByUser
        Get a specific devid owned by a particular userid. The dev id must exists as a valid device, the userid must exists as a valid user, and the 'uses' relationship must exists from user to device.
        Parameters:
        userId - String representation of user id
        devId - String representation of device id
        Returns:
        Instance of matching Device
        Throws:
        InvalidUserId - if the userId is invalid
        InvalidDeviceId - if the devId is invalid
        DeviceNotOwnedByUser - if the device isn't owned by the user

      • getAllUserDevices

        public Collection<com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device> getAllUserDevices(String userId)
                                                                 throws InvalidUserId
        Returns all the devices owned by the userId
        Parameters:
        userId - String representation of user id
        Returns:
        Collection of Device objects owned by user, or null if none
        Throws:
        InvalidUserId - If the userId is invalid

      • getMatching

        public Collection<com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device> getMatching(com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device partial)
        Find and returns all matching devices based on partially specified Device

        If the partially specified device includes a devId field then that one property is used to match. If the devId is not present, then all other properties are used using a GraphQuery to match. This means passing in a devId will allow you to retrieve a specific device and bypass the normal requirement that device retrieval requires knowledge of the user who uses it.

        Note that no exceptions are thrown. An invalid devId is handled a simply a null response.

        Parameters:
        partial - Partially completed Device object
        Returns:
        Collection of Device objects matching partial, or null if none

      • add

        public com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device add(String userId,
                                     com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device d)
                                       throws InvalidUserId
        Insert new Device instance into Graph associated with User userId
        Parameters:
        userId - String representation of the User owning the Device
        d - Device to be added. Note that the deviceId will be ignored
        Returns:
        Device object with correct deviceId reflecting object ID assigned by underlying graph;
        Throws:
        InvalidUserId - If the userId parameter does not match a valid user

      • update

        public boolean update(String userId,
             com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device d)
               throws InvalidUserId,
                      InvalidDeviceId,
                      DeviceNotOwnedByUser
        Updates (modifies) an existing device in the database. The device must be in a 'Used' relationship with the User. All fields from the Device parameter will overwrite the fields of the original Device. The device id will remain the same.
        Parameters:
        userId - String representation of the User who uses the device
        d - Updated Device object
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful; false if a database error was encountered
        Throws:
        InvalidUserId - If the userId parameter does not represent a valid user
        InvalidDeviceId - If the devId within the d parameter does not represent a valid device
        DeviceNotOwnedByUser - If the d.devId and userId are valid, but the device is not owner by the user.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(String userId,
             String devId)
               throws InvalidUserId,
                      InvalidDeviceId,
                      DeviceNotOwnedByUser
        Remove a Device from the database. The user must have a 'uses' relationship to the device for the operation to succeed.
        Parameters:
        userId - String representation of the user id who uses the device
        devId - String representation of the device to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeds; false if communication error to the database
        Throws:
        InvalidUserId - If userId parameter is not a valid user in the graph
        InvalidDeviceId - If devId parameter is not a valid device in the graph
        DeviceNotOwnedByUser - If the devId and userId are valid, but the device is not owner by the user.

      • getDeviceUserVertex

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex getDeviceUserVertex(String devId)
                                                    throws InvalidDeviceId
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceId

      • validOrException

        public void validOrException(String... devIds)
                      throws InvalidDeviceId
        Helper method which accepts a device id strings and either returns nothing to the caller or throws an InvalidDeviceId exception if any of the device id are invalid.
        Parameters:
        devIds - Variadic list of device id String representations
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceId - If any of the devId String parameters are not valid devices

        public com.giannoules.proxstor.api.Device get(String devId)
